Posts.Content: May 7, 2012 01:24PM lea321 wrote: definately big, button up shirts or ones that stretch easy.  I practically lived in my husbands tee shirts while I was recovering.  Also, a small pillow for the car ride.  The seat belt can be uncomfortable, and I kept a pillow in the car to keep it away from my chest.
Posts.Title: What to pack to the hospital for Mastectomy trigeek Tazzy

Posts.Content: lea321 wrote: I am 2 1/2 weeks post op, got my drains out 5 days ago, and I am having very slight bleeding still from drain area.  Like, I am talking a drop or 2. not a big deal.   But, the other side is healed up and great.  PS told me it is just 'stuff' that needs to come out, and allow it to.  told me not to compress to much to get it to stop.  (make sense right?)   anyone else have this happen? also suggested no showers until it is closed, which kind of stinks.  (pun intented) Dx 7/1/2008, DCIS, 1cm, Stage 0, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 7/27/2008 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel Surgery 8/10/2008 Lumpectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 9/23/2008 Breast Dx 2/28/2012, DCIS, 2cm, Stage 0, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR- Surgery 3/28/2012 Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left Surgery 8/22/2012 Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap Surgery 12/20/2012 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 1/20/2014 Reconstruction (left): DIEP flap; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: oozing/bleeding from drain site? lea321 lea321

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2012 05:55PM lea321 wrote: Thank girls, It finally stopped.  I am healing up pretty good, left incision is redder than the left.  I feel SO lucky that my PS taped my drains up really good and I was able to shower with my drains. I was dreading ahead of time not being able to take a shower, and was thrilled to find out I could.  Wow camillegal, 3 months??  I can't imagine!!
Posts.Title: oozing/bleeding from drain site? lea321 lea321

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2012 03:25PM lea321 wrote: Works great! Meant to add that I found it at a local medical equipment store. Same place I got my compression sleeve and bra.

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2012 03:30PM lea321 wrote: No, preventative only. I'm flying next week, they were recommended to me for certain things.
Posts.Title: Great tip for shoulder pain lea321 lea321

Posts.Content: lea321 wrote: Hi ladies! Since my BMX 4 weeks ago, I have a lot of stress/pain in my shoulders. I found the greatest pillow that really helps. Check out MotherearthPillows.com for neck pillows for the microwave filled with lavender. Helps soothe the muscles. Ahhhh..... Just wanted to share!
